item.title: Visualizing a logistic regression the easy way
item.description: Let’s visualize a GLM (logistic regression). First laod some data: data(tips, package = "reshape2") Compute a glm: glm1 <- glm(sex ~ tip, data = tips, family = "binomial") Plot the model using mosaic: library(mosaic) plotModel(glm1) The curve does not look really s-typed (ogive) but that’s ok because the data suggest not a strong trend.

item.title: Interactive diagrams in lieu of shiny?
item.description: One frequent use of the Shiny server software is displaying interactive data diagrams. The pro of using Shiny is the great flexibility; much more than “just graphics” can be done.
